Rule Against Perpetuities.definition: a common-law rule stating that in order for a future interest to be good it must vest after its creation

1.1: a common-law rule stating that in order for a future interest to be good it must vest after its creation (as at the death of a testator) within a life in being or lives in being plus 21 years plus the period of gestation of any beneficiary conceived but not yet born compare
